Expectation1: Review and analyze legal documents and contracts
Situation1: A purchase agreement needs analysis before an upcoming filing deadline that is drawing nearer.
Expectation2: Leading the daily prayers in the mosque
Situation2: A large gathering has assembled for a special remembrance, and no one else present is authorized to lead.
Story: I sat at my desk, legal documents spread before me, the clock ticking relentlessly toward the filing deadline. My client’s future depended on my careful review of the purchase agreement, every clause demanding my full attention. Yet, as I tried to focus, my phone buzzed with urgent messages from the mosque. A large crowd had gathered for a special remembrance, and I was the only one authorized to lead the prayer. The community expected my presence, my guidance, my voice to unite them in worship. My heart pounded as I stared at the contract, my mind torn between the duty to my client and the responsibility to my congregation. Both roles demanded my presence, my expertise, my care—at the same time. I felt the weight of their expectations pressing down, the fear of letting someone down gnawing at me. I closed my eyes, wrestling with the impossible choice, knowing that whatever I decided, a part of me would be left behind.
